compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building a comprehensive iOS-first mobile app UI for "Maak" (), a proactive family health observability platform for caregivers and families. The app follows a premium, calm, trustworthy design system with brand colors (Primary Teal #003543, Accent Gold #EB9C0C) and signature background treatments including a warm halo effect and subtle watermark patterns inspired by the Maak logo. The platform is built on monitoring (wearables + sensors)  observability (trends, context, risk)  AI Agent "Zeina" that turns insights into actions. I've specified requirements for RTL/LTR language support, reusable components with Auto Layout, consistent 8pt grid spacing, and a complete set of screens including onboarding, home dashboard, alerts, Zeina chat, profiles, trends/observability, care dashboard, and settings. The main tab navigation includes Home, Profile, Zeina, Family, and Track tabs, with Health Insights as one of my sections.

## Current state
We've successfully implemented all core screens with comprehensive functionality, beautiful teal gradients, and distinctive wavy teal gradient backgrounds throughout the app, including all 8 tracking category screens with interactive charts and quick-add functionality. I just finished making small adjustments to the Vital Signs screen header positioning by moving the title up slightly with negative margin and changing the subtitle color from white to the primary teal color for better visual hierarchy.

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building a comprehensive iOS-first mobile app UI for "Maak" (), a proactive family health observability platform for caregivers and families. The app follows a premium, calm, trustworthy design system with brand colors (Primary Teal #003543, Accent Gold #EB9C0C) and signature background treatments including a warm halo effect and subtle watermark patterns inspired by the Maak logo. The platform is built on monitoring (wearables + sensors)  observability (trends, context, risk)  AI Agent "Zeina" that turns insights into actions. I've specified requirements for RTL/LTR language support, reusable components with Auto Layout, consistent 8pt grid spacing, and a complete set of screens including onboarding, home dashboard, alerts, Zeina chat, profiles, trends/observability, care dashboard, and settings. The main tab navigation includes Home, Profile, Zeina, Family, and Track tabs, with Health Insights as one of my sections.

## Current state
We've successfully implemented all core screens with comprehensive functionality, beautiful teal gradients, and distinctive wavy teal gradient backgrounds throughout the app, including all 8 tracking category screens with interactive charts and quick-add functionality. I just finished updating all tracked health screen subtitles to use the primary teal color (#003543) for better visual hierarchy, and repositioned the Track Health tab heading to match the Home tab styling with white text positioned on top of the teal gradient background.

{"text":"The user wants to move the heading to the top. Looking at the current code, the heading has `mt-20` which pushes it down. They want it at the top of the teal gradient, similar to how other tracking screens have their headings positioned.

Looking at other tracking screens like VitalSigns, they have the heading positioned at the top without the `mt-20` spacing. I need to remove the `mt-20` class from the parent div.

However, the user has only selected the h1 element. To move it to the top, I need to modify the parent div's class (removing `mt-20`). This is outside the selected element.

I should ask for confirmation before proceeding.","signature":""}

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building a comprehensive iOS-first mobile app UI for "Maak" (), a proactive family health observability platform for caregivers and families. The app follows a premium, calm, trustworthy design system with brand colors (Primary Teal #003543, Accent Gold #EB9C0C) and signature background treatments including a warm halo effect and subtle watermark patterns inspired by the Maak logo. The platform is built on monitoring (wearables + sensors)  observability (trends, context, risk)  AI Agent "Zeina" that turns insights into actions. I've specified requirements for RTL/LTR language support, reusable components with Auto Layout, consistent 8pt grid spacing, and a complete set of screens including onboarding, home dashboard, alerts, Zeina chat, profiles, trends/observability, care dashboard, and settings. The main tab navigation includes Home, Profile, Zeina, Family, and Track tabs, with Health Insights as one of my sections.

## Current state
We've successfully implemented all core screens with comprehensive functionality, beautiful teal gradients, and distinctive wavy teal gradient backgrounds throughout the app, including all 8 tracking category screens with interactive charts and quick-add functionality. I just finished fine-tuning the Track Health tab header positioning and styling, moving it to the top of the teal gradient background, making the subtitle teal-colored, and updating the heading to be larger and bolder to match the Home tab styling.

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building a comprehensive iOS-first mobile app UI for "Maak" (), a proactive family health observability platform for caregivers and families. The app follows a premium, calm, trustworthy design system with brand colors (Primary Teal #003543, Accent Gold #EB9C0C) and signature background treatments including a warm halo effect and subtle watermark patterns inspired by the Maak logo. The platform is built on monitoring (wearables + sensors)  observability (trends, context, risk)  AI Agent "Zeina" that turns insights into actions. I've specified requirements for RTL/LTR language support, reusable components with Auto Layout, consistent 8pt grid spacing, and a complete set of screens including onboarding, home dashboard, alerts, Zeina chat, profiles, trends/observability, care dashboard, and settings. The main tab navigation includes Home, Profile, Zeina, Family, and Track tabs, with Health Insights as one of my sections.

## Current state
We've successfully implemented all core screens with comprehensive functionality, beautiful teal gradients, and distinctive wavy teal gradient backgrounds throughout the app, including all 8 tracking category screens with interactive charts and quick-add functionality. I just finished making final styling adjustments including updating the Home screen welcome heading to 32px font size, changing the Track screen section headings ("Tracking Categories" and "Recent Activity") to teal color, and updating the Zeina chat message text to white for better contrast.
